wikipedia_page.main: William Henry Adams (1809 – 29 August 1865) was a British politician (Conservative Party), lawyer and colonial judge.  His final appointment was as Chief Justice of Hong Kong.

response: *William Henry Adams (1809–1865), British Conservative MP for Boston and Chief Justice of Hong Kong

response: * William Henry Adams (1809–1865), British politician, lawyer and colonial judge

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1857 United Kingdom general election

response: On 24 October 1866, he was appointed as Chief Justice of Hong Kong replacing William Henry Adams who had died in office.  He served as Chief Justice until his retirement in 1881.
